query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Concept Design for Risk Analysis Methods and Components – Updated Cascading Effects approach
result.description: The effects of cascading effects on the vulnerability of local communities was addressed and documented in D6.1. As stated by end-users, the modelled vulnerability assessment could be useful on a strategic level during the planning or training phase. However, according to end-users feedback there still is the need of assessing potential cascading effects during response actions due to changes in hazard dynamics or hazard intensity that enforce them to split resources in the field. This deliverable will outline updated concepts on the assessment of cascading effects based on the gaps so identified.

result.description: This deliverable reports the use cases taken as reference for the project, and that will guide the design, development, and demonstration activities conducted in the project. result.title: 3rd version of the Dissemination and Communication Plan (DCP)
result.description: 3rd version of the Dissemination and Communication Plan, providing an overall framework for managing and coordinating targeted communication and dissemination activities to ensure enough publicity to the project activities, results and achievements in different ways to different targets, in order to support the exploitation strategy and widening and maximizing the impact. This deliverable will also include an updated version of the Dissemination and Communication Toolkit (a second brochure, a poster and a more detailed video presenting project main results and achievements and related case studies) (Task 8.1). In this deliverable, matrials for the dissemination of the project (DEC) will also be included.
